meanings.definition: Sharp or cutting satire or ridicule.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's lampoonery of politicians had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent2: Her lampoonery of the boss's speech was spot-on.
meanings.sent3: The lampoonery in the play brought humor to the audience.
meanings.sent4: His lampoonery of social norms was both clever and entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The writer's lampoonery left a lasting impression on the readers.

meanings.definition: The act of mocking or making fun of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Their lampoonery of the teacher's accent was hilarious.
meanings.sent2: The group's lampoonery of the new movie was well-received.
meanings.sent3: The lampoonery at the party lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her lampoonery of his fashion sense was playful yet pointed.
meanings.sent5: The children's lampoonery of each other's drawings brought smiles all around.
